lessons.title: Question: Events
lessons.interactiveContent:
What does an event do?

It gets triggered once a user does something on a webpageIt gets triggered only when a webpage loadsIt always changes an element's styling

It gets triggered once a user does something on a webpage.

lessons.title: Example: Onclick property
lessons.interactiveContent:
Code the onclick property to trigger the publish function when the button is clicked.

Make sure to type onclick.

lessons.title: Question: Event handler
lessons.interactiveContent:
What is an event handler?

A function called after an event is triggeredA function called before an event is triggeredA class added after an event is triggered

A function called after an event is triggered.

lessons.title: Example: Calling a function
lessons.interactiveContent:
Call the event handler for the onclick event.

Make sure to pick publish.

lessons.title: Example: Event handler II
lessons.interactiveContent:
Make this code change how the button looks after it's pressed.

Make sure to type textBold.

lessons.title: Example: Other elements
lessons.interactiveContent:
Add a click event to the div element.

Make sure to pick onclick.

lessons.title: Example: Onchange
lessons.interactiveContent:
Add the property to display the change to the input element only after the input is complete.

Make sure to pick onchange.

lessons.title: Example: OnInput
lessons.interactiveContent:
Add the property to display the input change while it takes place.

Make sure to type oninput.

lessons.title: Question: Onchange
lessons.interactiveContent:
What does this code do?

Displays changes to the input element only after the changes are doneDisplays changes to the input element while they're taking placeIt doesn't display anything

Displays changes to the input element only after the changes are done.

lessons.title: Question: Oninput
lessons.interactiveContent:
What does this code do?

Displays changes to the input element only after the changes are doneDisplays changes to the input element while they're taking placeIt doesn't display anything

Displays changes to the input element while they're taking place.

lessons.title: Question: Parentheses
lessons.interactiveContent:
What does addEventListener() do?

It defines what event handler is called when an event is triggered on an elementIt defines what event is called when an event handler is triggered on an elementIt removes event listeners

It defines what event handler is called when an event is triggered on an element.

lessons.title: Example: Add event
lessons.interactiveContent:
Code the correct method.

Make sure to pick add, followed by Event, and finally Listener.

lessons.title: Example: Parentheses
lessons.interactiveContent:
Code the correct event name and event handler function call.

Make sure to pick "click", followed by ,, and finally removeItem.

lessons.title: Question: Remove
lessons.interactiveContent:
In which case would we remove an event?

When we want an event to only happen a set number of timesWe remove it every time after we trigger it and set it again afterwardsWe never want to remove events

When we want an event to only happen a set number of times.

lessons.title: Example: Remove II
lessons.interactiveContent:
Code the methods in the correct location to make the event listener only trigger once.

Make sure to pick removeEventListener, followed by addEventListener.

lessons.title: Question: Touch start
lessons.interactiveContent:
When is the touchstart event triggered?

When a user attempts to move elementsWhen a user first touches an elementOn screen refresh

When a user first touches an element.

lessons.title: Example: Touch start
lessons.interactiveContent:
Code the touch event to call the touch() function when a user interacts with the box element.

Make sure to pick addEventListener, followed by touchstart, and finally touch.

lessons.title: Example: Function
lessons.interactiveContent:
Code the value that displays the message Touched! after a user touches the box element.

Make sure to type touchstart.

lessons.title: Question: Touch end
lessons.interactiveContent:
What happens at the end of the interaction with the box element?

A message reading done! appearsA message reading start! appearsThe color of the square changes

A message reading done! appears.

lessons.title: Example: Touch end
lessons.interactiveContent:
Code the touchend event to check whether a user has stopped interacting with the box-2 element.

Make sure to pick box-2, followed by touchend.
